an3.19:0.3: What it takes to run a successful business; and what it takes to increase in the skillful.
an3.19:2.3: Note: Not “object of concentration” as BB has it. The samadhinimitta is elsewhere defined as satipatthana, i.e. the meditation that you do in order to get into jhana. Nimitta, here and elsewhere in the suttas, means neither “object” nor “meditative vision”, but “cause”.
